Class CredentialPolicyPasswordRuleChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.users.authentication.CredentialPolicyPasswordRuleChecker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PasswordRuleChecker

    public class CredentialPolicyPasswordRuleChecker
extends Object
implements PasswordRuleChecker
    Password rule checker that uses CredentialPolicy.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • checkPassword

        public boolean checkPassword(Collection<AuthenticationDomain> domains,
                    CredentialPolicyLevel level,
                    List<Notification> notifications,
                    String password)
        Description copied from interface: PasswordRuleChecker
        Check a password and return message to user about any problems.
        Specified by:
        checkPassword in interface PasswordRuleChecker
        Parameters:
        domains - the authentication domain(s) in which the password will be used.
        level - the policy level.
        notifications - notifications from checking the password.
        password - the password.
        Returns:
        true if password is ok, otherwise false.

      • checkPassword

        public boolean checkPassword(CredentialPolicy policy,
                    List<Notification> notifications,
                    String password)
        Check the password against the policy.
        Parameters:
        policy - the policy.
        notifications - the notification list to populate if necessary.
        password - the password.
        Returns:
        true if okay, false if the password has a problem.

      • getRulesMessage

        public LocalizedObjectKey getRulesMessage(Collection<AuthenticationDomain> domains,
                                 CredentialPolicyLevel level)
        Description copied from interface: PasswordRuleChecker
        Get the message about the required password format. Presented to user before entering a password.
        Specified by:
        getRulesMessage in interface PasswordRuleChecker
        Parameters:
        domains - the authentication domain(s) in which the password will be used.
        level - the policy level.
